thread.title: Beyonce shows off pregnancy style in touching video of baby bump during award season
thread.title_full: Beyonce shows off pregnancy style in touching video of baby bump during award season

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: Beyonce shows off pregnancy style in touching video of baby bump during award season
text:
Beyonce shows off pregnancy style in touching video of baby bump during award season The star shared the sweet montage with her followers online Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Beyonce releases new video showing off baby bump Share this video Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Beyonce has continued to give fans a glimpse at her pregnancy journey with a touching montage uploaded for her followers on Instagram. 
The star - who is expecting twins with her husband Jay Z - shared a sweet video for her 96 million fans on the social media website, showing off her style during award season, with her figure on display in a number of outfits. 
Amongst the candid images are snaps of the star cradling her growing baby bump. Beyonce shared the pregnancy snaps with her fans (Photo: Beyonce.com) She posted them on her website (Photo: Beyonce.com) 
She can also be seen removing her makeup in one shot, and posing with her hip hop hubby in a cute moment. 
Other pictures include Bey in a stylish turquoise gown - which perfectly frames her pregnant figure - and some close-up looks at her jewellery. The montage included other candid snaps (Photo: Instagram/beyonce) Beyonce and Jay Z (Photo: Instagram/beyonce) 
The Bad Romance star, who will be touring this year, will be filling in for the Drunk In Love singer on April 15 and April 22. She also shared this sweet selfie with Blue Ivy (Photo: beyonce/Instagram) 
Confirming early reports, Gaga tweeted on Tuesday: "Let's party in the desert!" 
Last week, Beyonce, who is pregnant with twins, announced that she will no longer be headlining the annual event in after being advised to "keep a less rigorous schedule," but will take to the stage there in 2018 instead. 
The singer's management company Parkwood Entertainment released a joint statement with festival producer Goldenvoice, saying: "Following the advice of her doctors to keep a less rigorous schedule in the coming months, Beyoncé has made the decision to forgo performing at the 2017 Coachella Valley Music & Arts Festival."
